direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return sets derived from the map, but for different purposes (entries vs. keys).
Both methods return collections derived from the map, but for different purposes (entries vs. values).
Both methods involve iterating over map elements, but in different forms (set of entries vs. iterator).
The method directly decorates the entry set returned by entrySet(), making it unmodifiable.

enhanced_by.reason: Initialization of the map is required before accessing its entry set.
Setting up an unmodifiable map is necessary before accessing its entry set.
Both methods involve verifying the unmodifiability of the entry set and handle similar exceptions.
